results.title: Testament: The Bible and history
results.creator_credit: Ron Johnston, Mischa Scorer, Channel 4 and Antelope Films
results.brief_description: John Romer, an emminent archaelogist, undertakes a personal quest to examine the history of the Bible. He explores its origins and evolution through time as a rare and valuable sacred text, to a modern day paperback best seller available to the masses. Romer does not set out to discredit or disprove the literal truth of the Bible, but to examine how this influential text has shaped the world.

results.title: Test pilot
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Baines and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Danger”
Appraises the qualities needed by a test pilot and shows his day to day work, not only in actual flying but also in cooperating with the back-room boys.

results.creator_credit: R.H.R. Productions and Film Producers Guild
results.brief_description: Modern British aircraft development, with particular emphasis on recent experiments and achievements in supersonic flight. The learning, and discerning, planning and calculating of mathematicians, designers, technologists and pilots contribute to development of new and revolutionary aircraft.

results.title: Tess the old girl
results.brief_description: Charming story about the amazing Tess and how she went from lost dog’s home to breakfast around the Tan, RSPCA Million Paws Walks, holidays and even bumping into the odd celebrity. This much loved dog has become part of the family and enjoys nothing better than chasing trucks , barking at possums, and pulling clothes off the line. Spoilt she may be but everyone loves the old girl.

results.title: Tess of the D'urbervilles
results.creator_credit: Sarah Wilson, LWT, A&E Television Networks, Granada International Productions and Ian Sharp
results.brief_description: Justine Waddell plays the title role of tragic heroine Tess, sent away to work with distant relatives because of the abject poverty she and her family find themselves in. Working on the estate, Tess is relentlessly pursued and finally seduced by Alec D’Urberville. Tess flees from the estate only to discover she is pregnant; she loses the child and moves away from home once more. This time she starts work as a milkmaid, and love finds her again when she marries Angel Clare. When Angel discovers what happened between his wife and D’Urberville he abandons Tess who is left alone, once more forced to survive in harsh circumstances. Cast includes Justine Waddell, Jason Flemyng and Oliver Milburn.

results.title: Tess
results.brief_description: A faithful rendition of Thomas Hardy’s story of Victorian sexual and social hypocrisy. The pure village maiden Tess, supposed poor relation of the wealthy D’Urbervilles is seduced by one man and treated unfairly by another. Nastassia Kinski is perfect in the role of the doomed Tess.

results.title: Tesis [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Jose Luis Cuerda, Producciones del Escorpión S.L. and Alejandro Amenabar
results.brief_description: Alejandro Amenabar’s debut thriller fittingly begins with our conflicted heroine Angela (Ana Torrent) witnessing the aftermath of a gruesome train suicide and then finding it difficult to look away. Tesis then proceeds to fashion an examination or thesis if you will on the nature of voyeurism and our compelling need ‘to look’. From this disquieting opening sequence we then move on to the films central stage, a film school in Madrid where Angela is writing a paper on violence in cinema and television. Her research leads her to the schools extensive audio visual library, where much to her horror she discovers a snuff movie catalogued away with the rest of the titles. When her tutor mysteriously dies (whom she discovers with the snuff movie in his possession), Angela enlists the help of fellow student and resident film geek Chema (Fele Martinez), whose obsessive taste for violent cinema makes him a suspect as well as her only ally in solving the crime. Things begin to get dangerous however when the pair realize that the girl tortured and murdered in the snuff movie is also a student at their school. Cast includes Eduardo Noriega, Xabier Elorriaga, Miguel Picazo, Nieves Herranz. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Tertiary training in the RAAF
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Film Australia and Dennis Hill Productions
results.brief_description: This film depicts the training and lifestyles of the RAAF cadets. It shows the three study courses that are available to them in Australia; degrees in science, engineering and business studies. Suitable for secondary level.
